column2: TEXAS PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: TX

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column10: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 2. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 3. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column6: to you.
column10: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 4. What does this sign indicate?
column6: Train intersection

column2: 5. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.

column2: 6. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Brake lightly.
column8: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 7. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column6: red, green and yellow

column2: 8. Which shape is a stop sign?
column6: Pennant

column2: 9. This sign means:
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 10. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrian Crossing

column2: 12. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 13. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.
column6: check your rearview mirror.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: School zone ahead

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 16. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column6: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column8: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.

column2: 17. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column6: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column8: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: there is an intersection ahead.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 19. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column6: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column8: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column10: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.

column2: 20. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 21. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 22. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: be alert and obey all traffic signals.
column6: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column8: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column6: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column10: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

column2: 24. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column6: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 25. This road sign:
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column10: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 26. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column4: honk to let them know you’re there.
column6: yield.

column2: 27. This sign means:
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column10: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 28. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column6: red warning lights.

column2: 29. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column6: possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 30. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
